info.title: StoreCraft API
info.description: Welcome to the `StoreCraft` **API**

auth_admins_emails.description:
Seed admin emails, if absent will be infered at init by
`platform.env.SC_AUTH_ADMIN_EMAILS` environment as CSV of emails

auth_password_hash_rounds.description:
password hash rounds, if absent will be infered at init by
`platform.env.SC_AUTH_PASS_HASH_ROUNDS` environment

auth_secret_access_token.description:
access token signing secret, if absent will be infered
at init by `platform.env.SC_AUTH_SECRET_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment

auth_secret_refresh_token.description:
refresh token signing secret, if absent will be infered at
init by `platform.env.SC_AUTH_SECRET_REFRESH_TOKEN` environment

checkout_reserve_stock_on.description:
(Optional) automatically reserve stock, if absent will be
infered at init by `platform.env.SC_CHECKOUT_RESERVE_STOCK_ON` environment.

storage_rewrite_urls.description:
(Optional) Once object `storage` is used, you may have connected a
**CDN** to buckets to take advantage of faster assets serving instead of serving
from your server / the storage service directly. If you are using an cloud based
storage service such as AWS S3, it is very recommended to attach the bucket to
a **CDN** for super fast and efficient serving.

Take note, most cloud based storage services and `storecraft` drivers support creating
`presigned` urls for `download` / `upload`, which essentially delegate these operations
to the storage services. However, **CDN** is always the best choice for assets serving
cost and latency wise.

if absent will be infered at init by `platform.env.SC_STORAGE_REWRITE_URLS` environment.

token_type.description: The type of token, should be `bearer` or `refresh`

apikey.description:
The `apikey` is `base64_uri(apikey@storecraft.api:{password})`.
It will be shown only once to the user, at the `backend`, the password hash
will be saved, thus, the real password is only known to the user.

roles.description: list of roles and authorizations of the user

values.description: List of values, related to the key

handle.description: action handle for invocation at backend

optional description of what will happen
if the action is executed

allOf.description:
Every `extension` have `actions`,  that are registered as
**REST** endpoints

parameters.description:
Action might have extra parameters,
for example a partial refund action, may specify a variable value
for refunding, also with some of the `capture` actions,
which may capture less than intended.

items.description:
Upon status query, the gateway return a list of possible actions,
such as `void`, `capture`, `refund` etc...

actions.description: A list of `actions` supported by the gateway

CheckoutStatusEnum.description: Checkout status encapsulate the current state, see #CheckoutStatusEnum

PaymentOptionsEnum.description: Payment options encapsulate the current state, see #PaymentOptionsEnum

FulfillOptionsEnum.description: Fulfillment options encapsulate the current state, see #FulfillOptionsEnum

DiscountApplication.description: Discounts can be manual(coupon) or automatic types, see #DiscountApplicationEnum

get.description: Get the settings of your store
get.summary: Get the settings of your store

auth_admins_emails.description:
Seed admin emails, if absent will be infered at init by
`platform.env.SC_AUTH_ADMIN_EMAILS` environment as CSV of emails

auth_password_hash_rounds.description:
password hash rounds, if absent will be infered at init by
`platform.env.SC_AUTH_PASS_HASH_ROUNDS` environment

auth_secret_access_token.description:
access token signing secret, if absent will be infered
at init by `platform.env.SC_AUTH_SECRET_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment

auth_secret_refresh_token.description:
refresh token signing secret, if absent will be infered at
init by `platform.env.SC_AUTH_SECRET_REFRESH_TOKEN` environment

checkout_reserve_stock_on.description:
(Optional) automatically reserve stock, if absent will be
infered at init by `platform.env.SC_CHECKOUT_RESERVE_STOCK_ON` environment.

storage_rewrite_urls.description:
(Optional) Once object `storage` is used, you may have connected a
**CDN** to buckets to take advantage of faster assets serving instead of serving
from your server / the storage service directly. If you are using an cloud based
storage service such as AWS S3, it is very recommended to attach the bucket to
a **CDN** for super fast and efficient serving.

Take note, most cloud based storage services and `storecraft` drivers support creating
`presigned` urls for `download` / `upload`, which essentially delegate these operations
to the storage services. However, **CDN** is always the best choice for assets serving
cost and latency wise.

if absent will be infered at init by `platform.env.SC_STORAGE_REWRITE_URLS` environment.

post.description:
Create a new API Key. Api key is a `base64` url encoded 
      `base64_url(id@apikey.storecraft.api:password)`, the `password` is **not saved** at the database, only 
      the hashed password. This can be used in **ANY** the following headers 

      - Authorization: Basic <apikey> 

      - X-API-KEY: <apikey>

post.description:
When upserting a `product`, 
  the following side effects will happen:
 
  - `collections` field will be used to form connections with `collections` 
 
  - It will form connections with eligible product `discounts` 
 
  - If it is a `variant`, it will be connected to it's parent
Upsert a `variant`, a `variant` is a regular     product with the following fields set `parent_id`, `parent_handle`, `variant_hint`

get.description:
Get storefront data by its `id` or `handle` 
- Eligible  expand connection are `('collections, 
    products, discounts, posts, shipping, search')`

schema.description: The `id` or `handle` of storefront

Expand connections of item, 
            a **CSV** of connection names, example `(search, discounts)` (Use `*` for all)

post.description:
When upserting a `storefront`, the   following side effects will happen:
   - `collections` field will be used to form connections with `collections` 
   - `products` field will be used to form connections with `products` 
   - `discounts` field will be used to form connections with `discounts` 
   - `shipping_methods` field will be used to form connections with `shipping` 
   - `posts` field will be used to form connections with `posts`

info.name: Paypal standard payments
info.description:
Set up standard payments to present payment buttons         to your payers so they can pay with PayPal, debit and credit cards,         Pay Later options, Venmo, and alternative payment methods.
              You can get started quickly with this 15-minute copy-and-paste integration.         If you have an older Checkout integration, you can upgrade your Checkout integration.

get.description: Get the payment status of an order
get.summary: Get the payment status of an order

schema.description: The `id` of the order

handle.description: action handle for invocation at backend

description.description:
optional description of what will happen
if the action is executed

allOf.description:
Every `extension` have `actions`,  that are registered as
**REST** endpoints

parameters.description:
Action might have extra parameters,
for example a partial refund action, may specify a variable value
for refunding, also with some of the `capture` actions,
which may capture less than intended.

items.description:
Upon status query, the gateway return a list of possible actions,
such as `void`, `capture`, `refund` etc...

actions.description: List of possible actions to take

messages.description:
A list of messages of the current payment status,
for example `150$ were authorized...`

schema.description: A payment `status`

post.description: Payment gateways support custom actions to complete things such as `capture / refund / etc`,     This endpoint, will fetch the order, lookup the matched payment gateway and invoke the specified     `action` in the gateway

schema.description: The `handle` of the action supported by the payment gateway, that processed this order
